content.question:
At vero Aeneas aspectu obmutuit amens,

arrectaeque horrore comae et vox faucibus haesit.

Ardet abire fuga dulcesque relinquere terras,

attonitus tanto monitu imperioque deorum.

Heu quid agat? Quo nunc reginam ambire furentem

audeat adfatu? Quae prima exordia sumat

atque animum nunc huc celerem nunc dividit illuc

in partesque rapit varias perque omnia versat.

Haec alternanti potior sententia visa est.

Aeneid 4.279-287

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. Identify a stylistic device in lines 1-2 (At . . . haesit).

2. Write out all of line 2 (arrectaeque . . . haesit) and mark the scansion.

3. According to line 3 (Ardet . . . terras), what does Aeneas want to do?

4. Who had delivered to Aeneas the warning and command mentioned in line 4 ?

5. Translate in context the word alternanti (line 9).

6. (A) Translate in context the verb visa est (line 9) and (B) identify its tense.
